definitions.definition: To touch; to feel or hold with the hand(s).
To accustom to the hand; to take care of with the hands.
To manage, use, or wield with the hands.
To treat, to deal with (in a specified way).
definitions.example: she handled the news with grace, the Persians handled the French ambassador shamefully

definitions.definition: To deal with (a subject, argument, topic, or theme) in speaking, in writing, or in art.
To receive and transfer; to have pass through one's hands; hence, to buy and sell.
definitions.example: a merchant handles a variety of goods, or a large stock

definitions.definition: To be concerned with; to be an expert in.
To put up with; to endure (and continue to function).
definitions.example: I can't handle this hot weather.

definitions.definition: To illegally touch the ball with the hand or arm; to commit handball.
To behave in a particular way when handled (managed, controlled, directed).
Having a specified number or kind of handles.
